definition: hegemon/tyrant/lord/feudal chief/to rule by force/to usurp/(in modern advertising) master
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: Which one not reaching the top of a successful person heart undoubtedly the swagger?
sentences.chinese: 哪一个登上成功顶峰的人心中没有傲视群雄的霸气？

sentences.english: According to the list, the Houston Rockets' recent 2 losses were attributed to Yao's lack of aggressiveness.
sentences.chinese: 榜单称，火箭队最近两场输球全是因为姚明缺乏霸气。

sentences.english: Beautiful increased so as my agent, my domineering culture .
sentences.chinese: 漂亮就这样成为我的增高剂，培养了我的霸气。

sentences.english: Silent hegemonist. This is the only description I could think of.
sentences.chinese: 寂静的霸气，是我唯一能想到的形容词。

sentences.english: His elder sister is also a woman of great vigor.
sentences.chinese: 他姐姐也是有霸气的女人。

sentences.english: Others are coiled by daunting dragons.
sentences.chinese: 还有一些被霸气十足的神龙盘绕着。

sentences.english: Some even praised it saying the animal looked extremely "mighty and powerful".
sentences.chinese: 有些人甚至称赞这只动物看起来极其威武霸气。

sentences.english: The doctor tells Coby the symptoms he is suffering is a form of haki.
sentences.chinese: 大夫那意思好像说科比有一种霸气可惜不会使。

definition: the Way of the Hegemon/abbr. for 霸王之道/despotic rule/rule by might/evil as opposed to the Way of the King 王道/overbearing/tyranny/(of liquor, medicine etc) strong/potent
ample/complete/hundred percent/a pure shade (of some color)
